name: Central Europe Energy Partners
membership:
European Policy Center (EPC)
European Energy Forum (EEF)
goal: Central Europe Energy Partners (CEEP) is an association of energy and energy-intensive companies, organisations and scientific institutions from Central European countries. It was established in June 2010, and now has 11 members from 4 countries, which are employing more than 100,000 employees, and an overall revenue of Euros 20 billion (see the activities of CEEP on the website: www.ceep.be).
interests: Budget, Climate Action, Competition, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Information Society, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
